## Relevering Beta – Aurora Technologies

```{r}
#| eval: true
#| results: asis
#| echo: false
#| warning: false
library(webexercises)
beta_asset <- rnorm(1, mean = 0.8, sd = 0.05)
de_ratio <- rnorm(1, mean = 1.2, sd = 0.2)
tax_rate <- rnorm(1, mean = 0.30, sd = 0.02)
```

Aurora Technologies has an asset beta of **`r round(beta_asset,2)`**.  
Its debt-to-equity ratio is **`r round(de_ratio,2)`**, and the corporate tax rate is **`r round(tax_rate*100,2)`**%.  

::: {.question-block}
<form onsubmit="event.preventDefault();" style="display: flex; flex-direction: row; gap: 6px;">
  <label for="module4_num_q6a"><strong>1. What is the equity beta of Aurora Technologies?</strong></label>
  <input type="number" id="module4_num_q6a" name="module4_num_q6a" placeholder="Enter value" style="width: 150px;"
         data-correct-answer=`r round(beta_asset*(1+(1-tax_rate)*de_ratio),2)` data-tolerance="0.01" />
</form>

<div id="feedback-module4_num_q6a" class="feedback" style="display:none;">
✅ Equity Beta = β<sub>A</sub> × [1 + (1 – tax) × D/E] = **`r round(beta_asset*(1+(1-tax_rate)*de_ratio),2)`**.  
This accounts for financial leverage amplifying the risk borne by equity holders.
</div>
:::
